page.title: 02THE COMMUNITY BUS SERVICE
page.content: Stanford in the Vale has had a Community Mini bus since 1982. It cost #12,000. Sixteen passengers can travel on it and there are thirty to forty volunteer drivers.There is a daily bus service to Wantage and Faringdon taking in the villages of Hatford, Goosey, Denchworth, Charney Bassett and West Challow too. One hundred and ten people use the bus weekly. Eight thousand Old Age Pensioners have used the bus in the last two and a half years. It costs them 20p for a single journey and others 50p.The bus is also available for excursions and for private hire. There is a standard charge of #5 plus 25p a mile for petrol and the bus is hired regularly by such groups as Scouts, Guides, Brownies and the Ladies Darts Team. The bus tickets are of special interest to collectors.
